intro: Berlinianche, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy perennial in mild climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and often branched. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
